snippet: Ms. Gbagbo was sentenced Tuesday for her part in Ivory Coast’s postelection violence four years ago, which killed more than 3,000 people.
abstract: Simone Gbagbo, Ivory Coast's former first lady, is found guilty of undermining state security and sentenced to 20 years in prison for her role in 2010 postelection violence which resulted in more than 3,000 deaths.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Gbagbo was sentenced Tuesday for her part in Ivory Coast’s postelection violence four years ago, which killed more than 3,000 people.

headline.main: Ivory Coast: Former First Lady Simone Gbagbo Sentenced to 20 Years
headline.print_headline: Ivory Coast: Former First Lady Sentenced to 20 Years
